org.cyclops.evilcraft.core.tileentity.tickaction

Class TickComponent<C extends org.cyclops.cyclopscore.tileentity.CyclopsTileEntity,T extends ITickAction<C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cyclops.evilcraft.core.tileentity.tickaction.TickComponent<C,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - A tile that has a consume and produce slot.
    T - The type of tick action that this component has to tick for.

    public class TickComponent<C extends org.cyclops.cyclopscore.tileentity.CyclopsTileEntity,T extends ITickAction<C>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A component used in TickingTankInventoryTileEntity to support handling of ITickActions. A new instance can be created with a dictionary of (an extension of) ITickAction. It must be used like TickingTankInventoryTileEntity.updateTileEntity(). It will then tick for the given tile and slot and check the current item inside the given slot. It will then take the class of that item and lookup the item class inside that map to get the correct ITickAction on which it will call the methods.
    See Also:
    ITickAction, TickingTankInventoryTileEntity

    • Constructor Detail

      • TickComponent

        public TickComponent(C tile,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,T> tickActions,
                     int slot,
                     boolean redstoneDisableable,
                     boolean resetTickWhenCantTick)
        Make a new TickComponent.
        Parameters:
        tile - The IConsumeProduceTile reference in which this ticker runs.
        tickActions - The collection of actions this ticker can perform. It must map the item class to an extension of ITickAction.
        slot - The inventory slot this ticker applies to.
        redstoneDisableable - If this ticker can be disabled when given a redstone signal.
        resetTickWhenCantTick - If the tick progress has to be reset when one of the ticks can't continue.
